data.title: Getting to know the BUTLERS & how life was back then
data.text: The staff was very informative about the house and the BUTLER'S themselves. They take you to each room in the house and explain what it was used for by the BUTLER'S. Also, there was an adjacent cottage type house that I believe the BUTLER'S lived in till the big house was built.

owner_response.author: AustinErvin, Public Relations Manager at The Butler House ~ Deerfield Beach Historical Society, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Cynthia, 

We really appreciate the feedback. Hope to see you back at the Butler House soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: An historic treasure in the heart of Deerfield Beah
data.text: A "must" visit for the entire family.....to experience the real history of Deerfield Beach.  This historic House has been completely restored and contains many of the original Butler Family furnishings and artifacts including wicker furniture purchased by the Butlers in 1923 for $500.  Stop by for a guided tour on Saturdays provided by informative and friendly docents.  Be sure to check out the 100 year old banyan tree in the backyard....a real photo opportunity!

owner_response.author: AustinErvin, Public Relations Manager at The Butler House ~ Deerfield Beach Historical Society, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your kind words and feedback. We appreciated and enjoyed having you by for a tour and hope that you come back soon! Keep in mind we also have special events the last Sunday of every month. Check us out on Facebook or on our website where we will keep everyone updated. Thanks again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Enjoyed my visit
data.text: Very authentic and quaint. Knowledgeable staff. Very informative and friendly. Most beautiful tree in the back yard..huge! Great picture spot! A must see when you're in the area!!

owner_response.author: AustinErvin, Public Relations Manager at The Butler House ~ Deerfield Beach Historical Society, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Stephanie, we are so pleased you enjoyed your time at the Butler House! We do love that big Banyan tree and we try to have as many events as we can in that area. Check us out on our website and on Facebook to see upcoming events! :)
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A piece Deerfield beach history
data.text:
This was a freebie for national museum day so it was well worth the visit and the short tour.

The most fascinating thing to me was that it was built from plans in the ladies home journal Magazine!

It has most of the original furnishings and some donated clothing, etc items. Gives you an inside look at Deerfield Beach in the 1920's to the 50's. Don't miss seeing the 109 year old Banyan tree on the side of the house, as well.

owner_response.author: AustinErvin, Public Relations Manager at The Butler House ~ Deerfield Beach Historical Society, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Tours at the Butler House are always free but we appreciate donations!

If there was something we could have done to improve your experience, please let me know at historydeerfield@gmail.com.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A fabulous piece of Deerfield History
data.text: This is a real gem- nicely furnished with the original pieces. A great gift shop. The Historical Society does a very good job of explaining the history. I really fell in love with the little house in the back..apparently there are several of these along Hillsboro Blvd that were built to house the early railroad workers. If you love early Florida history, this is the place for you!

owner_response.author: AustinErvin, Public Relations Manager at The Butler House ~ Deerfield Beach Historical Society, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you! We really appreciate your feedback and are pleased that you have enjoyed spending time with us. We love the Kester Cottage, too :)

Thanks again and we look forward to seeing you back soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A Piece of Deerfield History
data.text: The Butler House is an original piece of property in the Deerfield Beach area.  It is an old house of no particular historic value.  It is important today for no reason I can think of.  It is not of an consequence achitecturally.  It is not located in any place that would bring memories or even a better understanding of the past.  It is used by the historical society as a venue for concerts and other community gatherings, but one of the many parks in Deerfield is better suited for that in many ways including parking.  If you are a hard core history buff and just have to know about the most obscure past in any area this is for you.  Otherwise, it is good for a walk through.

owner_response.author: AustinErvin, Public Relations Manager at The Butler House ~ Deerfield Beach Historical Society, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your feedback on The Butler House and the compliment regarding the walk-through. We would love another opportunity to show you just how important The Butler House and Kester Cottage are as pieces of Deerfield Beach's cultural and economic heritage.

Thanks again and we hope to see you back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful piece of Deerfield Beach history
data.text: The Butler house is a gem. I love going there and looking around. The outside is a beautiful place to sit and take in the sun. You can always sit under the 100 year old banyan tree and listen to some music when they are having a fund raiser.

owner_response.author: AustinErvin, Public Relations Manager at The Butler House ~ Deerfield Beach Historical Society, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for your kind words! We're pleased that you enjoy spending time at our location. If there is anything we can do to make your experience even better, please reach out to me at historydeerfield@gmail.com

Thanks again and we look forward to seeing you soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pioneer Family Home
data.text: The Deerfield Beach Historical Society does an excellent job of preserving the home of one of the pioneer families of the city.  The docent provided a detailed narrative on the family, each room and many of the objects on display, including clothes worn by family members and furnishings.  The two story main house is complimented by an adjacent one story building.  The architecture and construction of the buildings have been maintained as close to original as building codes allow. Donations to the Historical Society are accepted to help maintain the structure and support the community events that are sponsored monthly.

data.title: Great Piece of Local History
data.text: Being a Deerfield Beach resident, I am ashamed to not have visited sooner.  This home is free to visitors, however there is a spot for donations in the foyer.  Tours are given Saturdays by local volunteers and a there are small events held on the last Sunday of every month open.

data.title: A beautiful Banyon canopy to have an event under.
data.text: The people who take care of this old house are wonderful historians and while the house itself is not much to see, the history is very interesting. We have gone to several small events they hold there and have had a very nice time each time. And the whole back yard is covered with one of the biggest banyan trees in the area. So nice and  beautiful to sit under and have a beer and burger.

data.title: very interesting
data.text: OK I'm  a little biased, I really love history.  The wife and I went on the tour and it was great fun the tour guide was passionate about the butler house and I guess I would be also if I had grown up living in the area. very knowledgeable about  Mr and Mrs Butler as she had known them personally.  she loved the lemonade and sugar cookies as a kid.   I really appreciated her personal touch on such an interesting piece of history.  I cant wait to go back

data.title: Finally Made it
data.text: For years my husband and I had driven by the Butler House and often said we should stop. Well we finally made it. We were given a tour by a women who had grown up knowing the Butler's, so that made the visit more personal. It's a home that Mrs. Butler found in Lady's Home Journal. Only a certain number of plans were sent out and she was fortunate to get one. It's a compact house, and the historical society is trying to do a good job of upkeep. It is not open everyday. It is best to call or drive by and see when they are open. They try to have fund raiser's at least once a month at the house. It is well worth supporting. There is a beautiful, very large banyan tree on the property.

data.title: ~ What a great little piece of Deerfield Beach Architectural history !
data.text:
~ What a great little piece of Deerfield Beach Architectural history !  ~ With one of most gorgeous Florida "Bayan Tree"on the property. ~ Check out the pictures of the the property ~ that is very well kept ~ This house is located on 380 E Hillsboro Blvd in Deerfield Beach. It has great architectural history and reminds us what traditional living in South Florida really consisted of. ~ There is no entrance fee ~ Call before you go and check your local newspaper for events that they usual have on the weekend. ~ Opened 2pm to 5pm on Sundays ~ Call them at 954-429-0378 ~ Live music the last Sunday of every month ~ (see photos)

Here is an excerpt from their web site to give you a better understanding of the architecture ~ 

"This Mediterranean Revival style building was the home of Deerfield Beach pioneers and civic leaders, James D. and Alice Butler. The plans for the house were obtained from a popular ladies magazine, the September 1923 issue of the Ladies Home Journal. It cost $10,000 to build and it is situated on almost four city lots. The house is built of hollow clay tile, the interior walls are plaster on lath and the roof is made from Spanish terracotta tiles."

So if you are in the area and want to enlighten yourself on our local history. This is one of the places you should check off your list.

~ Cheers! ~

data.title: Pequeño museo
data.text: Es una casa antigua que muestra historia, es lindo para amantes de historia, llegue caminando de casualidad.

owner_response.author: AustinErvin, Public Relations Manager at The Butler House ~ Deerfield Beach Historical Society, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Gracias por su repuesta. Si hay algo que nosotros podemos hacer para mejorar su experiencia por favor escribeme en historydeerfield@gmail.com. Gracias.

Thanks for your feedback. If there is anything we could have done to improve your experience, please let me know at historydeerfield@gmail.com.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Interesante. Feria de antiguedades y articulos varios.
data.text: Casa de la Sociedad Histórica de Deerfield. Los últimos domingos de cada mes se hace una feria de antiguedades en el jardín, se pueden conseguir buenos precios en cuadros, libros, objetos de arte.
